table:table-cell.text:p: (The type of procedure is determined by the legal basis proposed in the draft act.)
Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs
Committee on Employment and Social Affairs
Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety
Committee on Industry, Research and Energy
Committee on the Internal Market and Consumer Protection
Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development
Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs
Committee on Women’s Rights and Gender Equality
Group of the European People’s Party (Christian Democrats)
Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament
Group of the Greens / European Free Alliance
The Left Group in the European Parliament – GUE/NGL

PV.Other.Text.text:p: MINUTES
TUESDAY 13 DECEMBER 2022
The sitting opened at 9.14.

text:h.OJ.ReportShortDescription.Text: Renewable Energy, Energy Performance of Buildings and Energy Efficiency Directives: amendments (REPowerEU)

text:p.OJ.PresentationCommission.Text: Report on the proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive (EU) 2018/2001 on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources, Directive 2010/31/EU on the energy performance of buildings and Directive 2012/27/EU on energy efficiency [COM(2022)0222 - C9-0184/2022 - 2022/0160(COD)] - Committee on Industry, Research and Energy. Rapporteur: Markus Pieper ( A9-0283/2022)

PV.Debate.Text.text:p:
Markus Pieper
introduced the report.

The following spoke:
Nils Torvalds (rapporteur for the opinion of the ENVI Committee)
.

The following spoke:
Frans Timmermans
(Executive Vice-President of the Commission).

The following spoke:
Elsi Katainen (rapporteur for the opinion of the AGRI Committee), Maria Spyraki, on behalf of the PPE Group, Nicolás González Casares, on behalf of the S&D Group, Morten Petersen, on behalf of the Renew Group
, and Ciarán Cuffe, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group
.

PV.Announcement.Text.text:p:
The President informed the House that she had convened an extraordinary meeting of the Conference of Presidents that day on the application of Rule 21 for the early termination of
Eva Kaili
’s term of office as vice-president.

The Conference of Presidents had unanimously decided to propose to Parliament that it bring to an end
Eva Kaili
’s term of office as Vice-President, pursuant to Rule 21.

Parliament would take a decision on that proposal at the beginning of voting time at noon that day, acting by a majority of two-thirds of the votes cast, constituting a majority of Parliament’s component Members.

text:h.OJ.ReportShortDescription.Text: Renewable Energy, Energy Performance of Buildings and Energy Efficiency Directives: amendments (REPowerEU)

text:p.OJ.PresentationCommission.Text: Report on the proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive (EU) 2018/2001 on the promotion of the use of energy from renewable sources, Directive 2010/31/EU on the energy performance of buildings and Directive 2012/27/EU on energy efficiency [COM(2022)0222 - C9-0184/2022 - 2022/0160(COD)] - Committee on Industry, Research and Energy. Rapporteur: Markus Pieper ( A9-0283/2022)

PV.Debate.Text.text:p:
The following spoke: Paolo Borchia, on behalf of the ID Group, Evžen Tošenovský, on behalf of the ECR Group, Sira Rego
, on behalf of The Left Group, András Gyürk, non-attached Member
, Dan Nica, Claudia Gamon, Martin Häusling, Georg Mayer, Anna Zalewska, Giorgos Georgiou, Gilbert Collard, Cristian-Silviu Buşoi, Tiemo Wölken, Iskra Mihaylova, Ignazio Corrao, Ivan David, Krzysztof Jurgiel, Sandra Pereira
, Francesca Donato, Jerzy Buzek, Tsvetelina Penkova, Nicola Danti, Manuela Ripa, Johan Nissinen, Mislav Kolakušić, Seán Kelly, Jens Geier, Mauri Pekkarinen, Pilar del Castillo Vera, Niels Fuglsang, Susana Solís Pérez, Angelika Niebler and Robert Hajšel
.

The following spoke under the catch-the-eye procedure: Radan Kanev, Maria Grapini, Michal Wiezik, Mick Wallace, Henna Virkkunen and Billy Kelleher
.

The following spoke:
Frans Timmermans (Executive Vice-President of the Commission) and Markus Pieper
.
The debate closed.
(The sitting was suspended at 10.37.)

text:h.OJ.ReportShortDescription.Text: This is Europe - Debate with the Prime Minister of Slovenia, Robert Golob

PV.Other.Text.text:p:
This is Europe - Debate with the Prime Minister of Slovenia, Robert Golob
( 2022/2931(RSP))
The President made an introductory statement.
The following spoke: Robert Golob (Prime Minister of Slovenia).

The following spoke: Paulo Rangel, on behalf of the PPE Group, Milan Brglez, on behalf of the S&D Group, Stéphane Séjourné, on behalf of the Renew Group, Philippe Lamberts, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, France Jamet, on behalf of the ID Group
, Ladislav Ilčić, on behalf of the ECR Group, Marc Botenga
, on behalf of The Left Group, Mislav Kolakušić, non-attached Member, Romana Tomc and Matjaž Nemec
.

The following spoke: Katalin Cseh, Thomas Waitz, Joachim Stanisław Brudziński, Carles Puigdemont i Casamajó, Seán Kelly and Miapetra Kumpula-Natri
.

The following spoke: Irena Joveva, Mikuláš Peksa, Laura Huhtasaari, Nicolas Bay, Bogusław Liberadzki
Clara Ponsatí Obiols
,
Robert Hajšel and Elena Yoncheva
.
The following spoke: Robert Golob.
The debate closed.
(The sitting was suspended briefly.)

PV.Vote.Text.text:p: Detailed voting results (amendments, separate and split votes, etc.) appear in the Results of Votes annex to these minutes.
The results of roll-call votes are published as an annex to these minutes and are available on Parliament’s website.
PV.Vote.Text.text:h: 8.1 Early termination of the term of office of a Vice-President (Eva Kaili) (vote)
PV.Vote.Text.text:p:
Proposal by the Conference of Presidents to bring to an end
Eva Kaili
’s term of office as Vice-President, pursuant to Rule 21
(Majority of Parliament’s component Members and two thirds of the votes cast required)
The President pointed out that, pursuant to Rule 187(3), in order to establish the two-thirds majority, account would be taken only of votes cast for and against.
Approved by RCV (625 in favour, 1 against, 2 abstentions)
PV.Vote.Text.text:h:
8.2
Instrument for providing support to Ukraine for 2023 (macro-financialassistance +)
***II (vote)
PV.Vote.Text.text:p:
Proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing an Instrument for providing support to Ukraine for 2023 (macro-financial assistance +) [ COM(2022)0597 - C9-0373/2022- 2022/0371(COD)]
- Committee on International Trade
Parliament approved the request for urgent procedure.
The following deadlines had been set:
- requests for separate votes and split votes: Tuesday 13 December 2022, 19.00.
PV.Vote.Text.text:h:
8.3 Notification under the Carbon Offsetting and Reduction Scheme for International Aviation (CORSIA)
***I (vote)

***I (vote)

PV.Approval.Text.text:h: 13Approval of the minutes of the previous sitting
PV.Approval.Text.text:p: The minutes of the previous sitting were approved.

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 14Question Time with the Commission - Protection of strategic infrastructure from China’s influence
PV.Other.Text.text:p: The President outlined the arrangements for Question Time with the Commission.

Margrethe Vestager
(Executive Vice-President of the Commission) answered the questions put by Members: Miriam Lexmann, Inma Rodríguez-Piñero, Catharina Rinzema, Tom Berendsen, Maria Grapini, Eugen Tomac, Viola von Cramon-Taubadel, Anna Bonfrisco, Joachim Stanisław Brudziński, Helmut Scholz and Reinhard Bütikofer
.
Question Time closed.

PV.Other.Text.text:p: Oral explanations of vote
Written explanations of vote
Explanations of vote submitted in writing under Rule 194 appear on the Members’ pages on Parliament’s website.

PV.Agenda.Text.text:p: The agenda of the next day’s sitting had been established (‘Agenda’ PE 739.999/OJ).

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 23Approval of the minutes of the sitting
PV.Other.Text.text:p: In accordance with Rule 202(3), the minutes of the sitting would be put to the House for approval at the beginning of the afternoon of the next sitting.
The sitting closed at 22.15.

PV.Decision.Decision.Introduction.Text: LIST OF DOCUMENTS SERVING AS A BASIS FOR THE DEBATES AND DECISIONS OF PARLIAMENT

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 1dAction taken on Parliament’s positions and resolutions
PV.Other.Text.text:p: The Commission communication on the action taken on the positions and resolutions adopted by Parliament during the October I and October II 2022 part-sessions was available on Parliament’s website.
